page.title: 01REVIEW OF SWANSEA WEST
page.content: {Swansea West comprises many villages {which the expanding town has "invaded" {to form part of the suburbs, e.g. {Sketty.These places retain some of {their original atmosphere.There are 3 {main types of housing:inter-war {private,post-war private and post-war {council houses.Transport facilities {are good,with the main A4118 running {through the area,linking Swansea with {Gower.Farming is mainly rough grazing. {There are areas of open grass and wood {land amongst the various housing {estates.During the working day, the {area is very quiet,as most people who {live in our area work outside it.It is {also fairly quiet in the evenings {because in general, young people go {into the city centre for {entertainment.This is not a tourist {area but the Gower beaches are nearby. { }
